comments.body: given that we need cython at runtime, do we also need compilers at runtime?

> given that we need cython at runtime, do we also need compilers at runtime?

good point! It always worked fine on the test servers because they have system-wide installs of the necessary compilers, but it definitely makes sense to use the conda framework here as well.

I also noticed that my test would have actually passed even if runtime compilation with Cython failed, because we have a fallback solution with numpy in place (it would raise a warning but would not fail). I now explicitly ask for Cython which will raise an error if the compilation is not successful. Because things became too long for a single `python -c` line, the test is now in `run_test.py`.
